# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = []
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            if line == ""
                line = word
            else
                line *= " " * word
            end
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)  # append last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example:

```julia
s = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped within the specified text width."
print(wrap_string(s))
```

Output will be:

```
This is a 
long string 
that needs to 
be wrapped 
within the 
specified 
text width.
```
